intro: Calamus sparsiflorus, commonly known as the sparse-flowered calamus, is a member of the Arecaceae (palm) family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its tall, slender stems and broad, pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters along the leaf stalks. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or swampy areas. Due to its unique floral structure and ecological niche, it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity.
